skillTree.localised_description: Within Barak Varr the Dwarfs maintain their Book of Charts, which makes seafaring possible for the Dwarfs. These charts have spared Dwarfs the irksome task of exploring; instead they have always known where they are going.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Barak Varr's Book of Charts"

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Upkeep: -10%
	(Lord's army)
Campaign movement range: +10%

Casualty replenishment rate: +10%
	(Lord's army)
Campaign line of sight: +50%

skillTree.localised_description: Rhymakangaz is the rune axe of Byrrnoth Grundadrakk. It is inscribed with a Rune of Might and many ancient Grudges.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Rhymakangaz"
Bonus vs Large: +10
Enables magical attacks
Attribute: Causes Fear

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10

Enemy leadership: -20 for Dragon units
	(local region)

skillTree.localised_description: The strong yet light armor of Byrrnoth Grundadrakk, forged from Gromril. It is inscribed with a Rune of Stone and a Rune of Iron.

effects.description: Passive ability: "Sea Armour"
Armour: +10
Ward save: 25%
Fire resistance: 70%

skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs are stubborn, but none more so than Grudgebearer, the founder of the Age of Reckoning.

effects.description: Leadership: +9

skillTree.localised_description: The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawi’s own reserves.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10%

skillTree.localised_description: To fire the forges and bring true craft and artifice back into the world.

effects.description:
Oathgold from buildings: +50%
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: A true Lord knows the Underway, his Dwarfhold and how to fight under the ground better than anyone.

effects.description:
Leadership: +6 when fighting against Skaven
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean siege battles
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 during subterranean intercept battles
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.

effects.description: Leadership aura size: +25%

skillTree.localised_description: This stubborn Dwarf refuses to yield or tire, and ensures his followers are of the same ilk.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -15%
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.

effects.description: Armour: +6

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +7
Charge bonus: +15

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Melee defence: +12

skillTree.localised_description: The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.

effects.description: Hit points: +7%
Hit points: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +7% when fighting against Greenskins
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins

skillTree.localised_description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

effects.description: Ability: "Foe-Seeker"

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10%
Weapon strength: +20%

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.

effects.description: Melee attack: +6
Melee attack: +12

skillTree.localised_description: A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.

effects.description: Melee defence: +6
Melee defence: +12

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are not fast, yet they will soldier on, always moving despite any hazards encountered.

effects.description: Speed: +7%
Speed: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

effects.description: Ability: "Deadly Onslaught"

skillTree.localised_description: When Byrrnoth heard the grim news of his father and brother, he abandoned his old life. Swearing an oath at the shrine of Grimnir to avenge his kin, he claimed his birthright, the axe Rhymakangaz, and took to the sea to hunt down the wyrm.

effects.description: Ability: "Mighty Oath Stone"

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Greenskins
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +20% when fighting against Greenskins
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Barak Varr's Dwarfs are famous for their inventions. Their war machines are also known as 'Zul Barag'.

effects.description:
Ammunition: +10% for artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Missile damage: +10% for embedded Master Engineer Heroes

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +20% for artillery units
	(Lord's army)

Missile damage: +20% for embedded Master Engineer Heroes
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for embedded Master Engineer Heroes
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The ships made by the Engineers of Barak Varr have strong defences and powerful cannons, and no enemy wants to exchange fire with such a fleet at sea.

effects.description:
Leadership: +10 when fighting at sea
	(Lord's army)
Passive ability: "Liquid Fortification" when fighting at sea

Ward save: 10% when fighting at sea
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Benefiting from their location at the mouth of The Black Gulf, Barak Varr is one of the few strongholds that has remained open to traders from other nations, and the Dwarfs there are renowned for their hospitality.

effects.description: Income from trade tariffs: +10%

Ironclad growth: +3
	(Lord's army)

Income from all buildings: +25%
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: King Byrrnoth is known to respect the traditions of the Dwarfs, and early in his reign became concerned that their culture was being diluted by contact with outsiders. He renewed the practice of sending Beardlings to Karak Kadrin to complete their education.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -15% for Longbeards and Hammerers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +10 for Longbeards, Hammerers, Ironbreakers and Slayer units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -25% for Longbeards and Hammerers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +15 for Longbeards, Hammerers, Ironbreakers and Slayer units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: King Byrrnoth maintains traditional Dwarf values in the face of a changing world, and always works to maintain a close relationship with the Holds of the Worlds Edge Mountains.

effects.description:
Control: +25
	(local province)
Hit points: +20%

Recruitment cost: -25%
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:

skillTree.localised_description: The Dwarf Warriors of Barak Varr are always the first to lead an attack, and are known for their speed and aggression in battle compared to other Dwarfs.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.

effects.description: Campaign movement range: +5%

skillTree.localised_description: Byrrnoth Grundadrakk is known for his epic journey to the far away Dragon Isles, where he slew a mighty Sea Dragon, avenging his father and brother.

skillTree.localised_description: Unlike the Engineers Guild in Zhufbar, the Sea Engineers Guild of Barak Varr is known for its powerful naval inventions. They also hold close many secrets of navigation and propulsion.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any attacker.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Barak Varr, which means the Gate to the Sea in Khazalid, is unique amongst the Dwarf strongholds for being the only Hold built to be a massive harbor.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Byrrnoth Grundadrakk is the King of the Dwarfen stronghold of Barak Varr. As the only Hold built to be a massive harbor, Byrrnoth learned the art of building iron ships in his youth, and has many friends and allies among the merchants and navigators.
